Key Arguments: The Bill threatens democratic processes and free speech.
It could harm mental and physiological well-being.
The Bill could negatively impact industries reliant on social media and internet services.
It allows government individuals to make decisions based on personal opinions and ideologies.
The Bill denies education, personal debate, and freedom of religion.
It does not adequately define or protect against government misinformation.
The Bill represents government overreach and is unethical.
The Bill has not been properly advertised or consulted with the public.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is a direct threat to free speech.
This Bill denies education and personal debate and discussion.
A government that is prepared to censor a different point of view contrary to a government view point... is dictatorship it is not leadership.
